instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont run on battery
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light water damage around LVDS

Replaced LVDS and computer works fine when plugged in.

If you unplug the charger the computer shuts off right away. 
Charger plugged in Green and turns Orange
OSX sees the battery, battery cycles, battery status, and battery percentage

Battery Gate <TRANSISTOR>Q7050</TRANSISTOR> is working and shows batt voltage on both sides and gate pin is 5v
<RESISTOR>R7008</RESISTOR> shows same voltage on either side
F7000 shows same voltage on either side. 

74% batt voltage is 11.76V

BIL does not show anything when pressed or charger plugged in. Lid switch does work.

Different battery has same results and BIL connector disconnected and it does the same.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont run on battery
threads.message: Nevermind figured it out. Trace on <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> was burned to the <SIGNAL>BATT_POS</SIGNAL> via
